III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12607 Agency Recomendation
Section • (4) An agency shall provide the applicants for adoption
Description with a signed and dated copy of the evaluation and
recommendation upon its completion.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation It is alleged that the agency did not provide the applicants
with a dated copy of the evaluation and recommendation.
Investigation The Complainant was interviewed on August 22, 2023, and
September 26, 2023. The Complainant is a agency worker with
Bethany Christian Services. The Complainant reported that Child
and Family Services Northeast had conducted two family adoption
assessments and had failed to provide the applicants with copies
of the assessments. The Complainant reported that the case was
transferred per DHHS to Bethany Christian Services on June 12,
2023. The Complainant reported that CFSNE had completed the
assessments on May 26, 2023, and the agency had not provided
the families with the assessments from that time until the case
was transferred on June 12, 2023.
Staff 1, the Adoption Supervisor for CFSNE was interviewed
on August 23, 2023, and September 26, 2023. The Adoption
Supervisor reported that the agency had conducted adoption
family assessments for two relatives, Relative A and Relative B.
The Adoption Supervisor reported that the agency did not agree
with the children being adopted by either Relative A or Relative B.
The Adoption Supervisor reported that Relative A had a
substantial criminal history as well as CPS involvement. The
Adoption Supervisor also reported that the children had vocalized
that they did not want to be placed with Relative A. The Adoption
Supervisor further reported that the children had vocalized that
they did not want to be placed with Relative B due to past
emotional and physical abuse.
The Adoption Supervisor reported that the agency did not send
the adoption assessments to either family because the case was
being transferred and Bethany Christian Services was to conduct
reassessments of Relative A and Relative B per DHHS. The
Adoption Supervisor reported that DHHS felt that CFSNE was
biased against the relatives and wanted reassessments. The
2

Adoption Supervisor reported that the initial assessments were
completed on May 26, 2023, and the case was transferred to
Bethany on June 12, 2023. The Adoption Supervisor reported that
sending denial letters to the relatives could make reassessments
for Bethany more difficult. This and the understanding that
reassessments were to be completed by Bethany were the factors
in the agency not sending the assessments to the relatives. The
Adoption Supervisor reported that she could not specifically recall
who from DHHS wanted reassessments to occur with the new
agency.
The Chief Administrator was interviewed on September 26,
2023. The Chief Administrator reiterated and confirmed the
information received from the Adoption Supervisor. The Chief
Administrator stated that the assessments and denial letters were
not sent to Relative A and Relative B as the case was being
transferred to a Bethany Christian Services and DHHS wanted the
new agency to reassess the families.
DOCUMENT REVIEW:
Case File Review: The case file documents that family adoption
assessments for Relative A and Relative B were completed on
May 26, 2023. In each case the agency was recommending denial
of the adoption placements.
Email correspondence: Email correspondence between the
Adoption Supervisor and the DHHS Monitor dated August 11, and
14, 2023, suggest that Bethany Christian Services will be
reassessing Relative A and Relative B.
Email correspondence between the Adoption Supervisor and the
Complainant dated July 6, and 12, 2023, was reviewed. An email
dated July 6, 2023, from the Adoption Supervisor to the
Complainant states that the families were not notified of the
assessments and denials. An email dated July 11, 2023, from the
Adoption Supervisor to the Complainant states the families were
not notified because Bethany would be reassessing the families.
Analysis The agency did not send the relatives denial letters and the
assessments as the case was being transferred to another
agency. The agency was also operating under the assumption
that Relative A and Relative B were to be reassessed by the new
agency holding the case.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED

Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12207 Staff responsibilities
Section • (3) An agency shall require that social service workers
Description be directly responsible for all of the following activities:
• (a) Placing and supervising children in out-of-
home care. Social service workers shall work
directly with the children, their families, and
other relevant individuals and be primarily
responsible for the development,
implementation, and review of service plans for
the children and their families.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation It is alleged that the agency worker was refusing to provide
all parties with a copy of the written adoptive assessments.
Investigation The Adoption Worker reported that she had not refused to send
all parties the completed assessments. The Adoption Supervisor
reported that the completed assessments were on the MISACWIS
system for DHHS and Bethany Christian Services staff to review.
In an email dated August 11, 2023, to the DHHS Monitor the
Adoption Supervisor states that after the case was transferred to
Bethany on June 12, 2023, CFSNE no longer held the case and
she was no longer the supervisor, therefore, CFSNE would not be
making a recommendation or sending out denial letters.
Analysis The adoption family assessments were available on the
MISACWIS system for review by Bethany staff and DHHS. The
assessments and denial letters were not sent to the families for
the reasons outlined under R. 400.12607 above and after June
12, 2023, the agency no longer held the case.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
The recommendation is for continuance of the regular license.
